thread.title: Australian Duo, Air Supply, to Make World Tour Stop at Ameristar Kansas City Friday, Jan. 29
thread.title_full: Australian Duo, Air Supply, to Make World Tour Stop at Ameristar Kansas City Friday, Jan. 29

title: Australian Duo, Air Supply, to Make World Tour Stop at Ameristar Kansas City Friday, Jan. 29
text:
Australian Duo, Air Supply, to Make World Tour Stop at Ameristar Kansas City Friday, Jan. 29 October 20, 2015 08:30 ET   
KANSAS CITY, Mo., Oct. 20,   Put a little romance into your partner's holiday stocking with tickets to Air Supply, on sale now for their Friday, Jan. 29, 2016, show in Ameristar Casino Hotel Kansas City's most intimate concert venue, The Star Pavilion . 
Air Supply's Graham Russell & Russell Hitchcock have been performing beautiful harmony together for more than 41 years. Chart topping hits like "Lost in Love", "All Out of Love", "The One That You Love", "Sweet Dreams", and "Making Love Out Of Nothing At All" are known the world over as everyone's favorite love songs. 
Treat your special someone to a very romantic evening with Air Supply in Ameristar's Star Pavilion. Seating is limited. Tickets range from $35 to $50, and can be purchased by visiting www.ticketmaster.com or in Ameristar's gift shop. The doors open at 7 p.m. and the show starts at 8 p.m. Guests must be 21 years of age and present a valid photo ID. All seats are reserved. 
For more information on upcoming concerts and events visit us on Facebook at www.facebook.com/Ameristar.Casino.KC 
About Ameristar Kansas City 
Located just east of downtown Kansas City, Ameristar Casino Hotel Kansas City offers an exceptional gaming and entertainment experience. The property features the largest casino and the most games in the Kansas City area, as well as one of the largest poker rooms in the Midwest. The property includes a 140,000 square-foot casino; a AAA Three Diamond full-service hotel with 184 well-appointed rooms and suites; seven dining venues, a brewery, live entertainment in several venues featuring national and regional acts; an 18-screen movie theater; a supervised children's entertainment complex; a video arcade and 15,000 square-feet of meeting and event space. Roxann M. Kinkade, APR Director of Public Relations 816-719-9494
